agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that operates various support services for homeless individuals and families, including shelter services.
service_description: Provides case management services for eviction prevention, including late rent, COVID-19-related rent forgiveness, rehousing after eviction, landlord engagement, utility payments and deposits, move-in fees, and late rent. agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Clark, Floyd, Harrison, and Scott County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, housing issues, and public benefits. Preference is given to legal problems that prevent clients from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted.
site_details: Call during service hours or complete online application. Be prepared to answer questions about household income and assets.
site_eligibility: Income 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- With a civil legal issue that does not generate fees

service_description: Serves as an entry point for infants and toddlers who have or are at risk for developmental delays. Services include home-based special instruction; occupational, physical, and speech therapy; access to health and social services; and case management.

agency_desc: County organization responsible for filing, recording, and entering orders from the Countys Court system pertaining to civil, juvenile and criminal matters; issuing letters of administration, letters of guardianship, recording wills, inventories of estates, sale bills, final accounts and reports distribution in probate proceedings; serving as the Voter Registration officer for the county and receive candidate and election filings as applicable under state law. The Clerks office is also responsible for receiving child support and other court ordered payments and liabilities as well as issuing marriage licenses.
service_description: Oversees the administration of all county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance in Floyd County. This office also serves as a voter registration site and provides information about candidates, voting times and locations, absentee voting, and working the polls.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: To register to vote, walk in or register online at www.indianavoters.com. -- For election information, call this office.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: To register to vote in Floyd County: United States citizens -- Living in Floyd County -- At least 18 years old on the day of the next election -- Not currently imprisoned after being convicted of a crime -- To vote in Floyd County: Registered in current precinct at least 29 days before the election
Varies by service; serves Floyd County

For marriage license: Both parties at least 18 years old (call for exceptions) -- At least one a Floyd County resident, or both from out of state -- For certified copies of a marriage license: License must have been issued in Floyd County
Parents ordered by the Floyd County Court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Government agency responsible for strategic planning and organizational management of natural and man made disasters occuring in Floyd County, Indiana.
service_description: Provides planning and management of natural and man made disasters occurring in Floyd County.
site_details: Call or walk in
site_eligibility: Floyd County residents

agency_name: FLOYD COUNTY PLAN COMMISSION AND BOARD OF ZONING APPEALS
agency_desc: Government agency that provides planning and zoning for Floyd County.
site_name: FLOYD COUNTY PLAN COMMISSION AND BOARD OF ZONING APPEALS
service_description: Issues building, electrical, plumbing and heating permits, approves new addresses, rezoning, subdivision plat approval, variances and special uses, and provides new building inspections.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Bodies
Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_eligibility: Floyd County residents

agency_desc: Represents the State of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Floyd County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Floyd County
Floyd County residents and those who are victims of crimes that occurred within the jurisdiction of Floyd County, Indiana.

To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Floyd County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Responsible for maintaining land records, deeds, mortgages and all other legal documents affecting title to real property.
service_description: Oversees records deeds, mortgages, assignments, releases, Power of Attorney, real estate contracts, annexations, Trustee elections, affidavits, final decrees, surveys, Federal Tax Liens, Mechanic Liens, military discharges, Articles of Incorporation, cemetery deeds, bonds, plats, condominiums, Assumed Business Name Certificates, Delinquent Sewer Liens, leases, and miscellaneous instruments.  Also files Uniform Commercial Codes and provides copies of any instrument and certifies to those recorded upon request.
site_details: Walk In.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Government office responsible for property tax collection.
service_description: Responsible for depository of tax obligations, collection of property taxes, collection of inheritance taxes, processing of liquor license renewals, processing of mobile home relocation permits, county investments and auditing.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information
site_eligibility: Floyd County residents

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services for men and women incarcerated in or newly released from prison or jail.
service_description: Provides mentoring and support groups for men and women newly released from prison or jail to help them break the cycle of crime and addiction and become spiritually mature, emotionally stable and gainfully employed members of the community.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Men and women age 18 or older recently released from prison or jail, or persons with substance abuse issues.
Caregivers and family members of inmates and recently released offenders
Inmates and recently released offenders
Children age 4-17 years-old of incarcerated and newly-released inmates

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization that provides pregnancy counseling and services, parenting classes and material assistance.
site_name: CHOICES LIFE RESOURCE CENTER - NEW ALBANY
service_description: Provides faith based services including free pregnancy tests, pregnancy counseling, post-abortion support, parenting support, limited OB ultrasounds, peer counseling, maternity and baby supplies, and referrals to other related services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for information; Walk-ins accepted for pregnancy tests only.

agency_name: NEW ALBANY TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - FLOYD COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: NEW ALBANY TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - FLOYD COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: FLOYD COUNTY LIBRARY - NEW ALBANY CENTRAL
service_description: Provides an array of library services including borrowing books, periodicals, media items for adults, teens and children, reference books and databases, inter-library loan service, programming for all ages, "Walking Books" programs for the homebound, and Indiana History Room with genealogical capabilities. Also offers internet access and computer workstations with printer, WiFi, and laptops for use in the Library. In addition, provides computer classes and assistance with job search.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information. www.floydlibrary.org
site_eligibility: Floyd County residents or property owners and reciprocal borrowers from Clark and Harrison counties. Parents or legal guardians must sign the application for children under the age of 16 and also show an approved form of identification.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Provides an array of library services including borrowing books, periodicals, media items for adults, teens and children, reference books and databases, inter-library loan service, programming for all ages, "Walking Books" programs for the homebound, and Indiana History Room with genealogical capabilities. Also offers internet access and computer workstations with printer, WiFi, and laptops for use in the Library. In addition, provides computer classes and assistance with job search.
site_details: Call or visit the website to schedule curbside pickup.
site_eligibility: Floyd County residents or property owners and reciprocal borrowers from Clark and Harrison counties. Parents or legal guardians must sign the application for children under the age of 16 and also show an approved form of identification.

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY CLARK AND FLOYD INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Clark and Floyd County.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY CLARK AND FLOYD INDIANA
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low income persons in Clark and Floyd County.  Participants contribute a set number of labor hours ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan.
site_details: Call for information
site_eligibility: Must meet income guidelines and pass application screening process.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Floyd County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority, including performing the following duties: controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Floyd County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutors office, private attorneys, or individuals representing themselves.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - FLOYD COUNTY PROBATION DEPARTMENT
service_description: Provides probation services for the Floyd County Circuit Court, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Floyd County Courts
